info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 9 at 8:53PM EDT until August 10 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston SC
info.description:
FFWCHS
The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Charleston County in southeastern South Carolina...
* Until midnight EDT tonight.
* At 853 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Johns Island, West Ashley, James Island, Hollywood, Folly Beach, Ravenel, Kiawah Island, Meggett, Wadmalaw Island and Yonges Island.
Western Charleston County has already received several rounds of moderate to heavy rain so far today and additional heavy rain showers are now moving onshore. Rainfall amounts so far today of up to 2.5 inches have occurred across an area including Folly Beach, Johns Island, and Wadmalaw Island. An additional 1 to 2 inches of rain will be possible over the next hour. Of particular concern is the Folly Beach area, and any locations along and near tidal creeks and streams, as we are near the time of high tide. Roads within the warned area could become flooded and impassable.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
